column1: Smoque BBQ////Here's my take: Their ribs are very meaty and tender
column2: with a bit of char on the outside.  Slow-cooking melts away most of the fat.  The woody-smoky flavor is just right and does not overwhelm the flavor of the pork.  The meat does not quite fall off the bone
column3: but you don't have to do much gnawing either.  Ribs are served dry
column4: with the sauce on the side.  The "Memphis" BBQ sauce is better'n any I've had in Memphis.
